intro: Daucus turgenia, commonly known as Turgen's carrot, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots are typically thin and not as robust as those of the common carrot. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and historical use in traditional medicine.
